issue.title: Modify build_targets for the test

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
When I trained and tested custom model with custom dataset, I had got NaN loss error during the test.

That problem is caused by reject flag that used for model to be trained with object size has proper IOU in training process. 

I removed that flag and condition and then that problem is solved.

It seems like to cause NaN loss during the test if we do not have enough anchors to compatible with the size of bounding box in test dataset.

So I added the condition to neglect reject flag during the test.

What do you think of this?

issue.title: Train YOLOv3-SPP from scratch to 62.6 mAP@0.5

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Hi,
Thanks for sharing your work ! 
I would like what is your configuration for the training of yolov3.cfg to get 55% MAP ? 
We tried 100 epochs but we got a MAP (35%) who don't really change much more. And the test loss start diverge a little. 
Why you give a very high loss gain for the confidence loss ? 
Thanks in advance for your reply.[
![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43119691/58714806-d5c89880-83c5-11e9-90ea-b7a8fd2703c2.png)
](url)

issue.title: Training YOLOv3 Tiny with correct mask

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Hi, Thanks a lot for the repository. I am trying to find tiny yolov3 weights with correct mask.

The weights file at - https://pjreddie.com/media/files/yolov3-tiny.weights was trained with incorrect mask 1,2,3 instead of 0,1,2 (refer issue - https://github.com/pjreddie/darknet/issues/851).
When I use the same weights file with this repository with mask 0,1,2 - I get mAP 0.178 with 0.001 conf threshold (0.153 with 0.1). However, when I change  the mask in cfg/yolov3-tiny.cfg to -  1,2,3 I get the expected mAP of 0.332 with 0.001 conf threshold (0.278 with 0.1) 
 
So, now I am trying train a model on my own with - yolov3-tiny.conv.15 as the seed. However, after 75 epochs, mAP with 0.1 confidence threshold 0.1 is still 0.207. I am using the ultralytics default hyperparameters. If you could provide any suggestions how to improve the performance, it would be very welcome. 
If there is any other trained yolov3-tiny weights that I can use, that will be great too. I tried the models from this location - https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1uxgUBemJVw9wZsdpboYbzUN4bcRhsuAI, but it seems they have the same model weights as the darknet repo.

Results - 
[results.txt](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/files/3143640/results.txt)

body:
Another example. Also of note is that objectness validation losses are far higher than training losses, the only one of the 3 loss components to display this behavior.

![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26833433/63653098-a927e100-c768-11e9-8959-af940b254fd1.png)

issue.title: Have you ever trained the model without weight decay?

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Have you ever trained the model for CoCo dataset without weight decay?

When I trained and tested my model with custom data, using weight decay method harm performance.

Best mAP during 68 epochs
0.95(with weight decay) vs 0.985(w/o weight decay)

issue.title: Default argument settings to reproduce the mAPs you provide

repository.name: yolov3
repository.description: YOLOv3 in PyTorch > ONNX > CoreML > TFLite

issue.body:
Hello,

For training, this repo let us type "python train.py". But, there are several arguments such as "mult-scale, prebias" which are not set by default. I guess you probably used those arguments to reproduce the mAPs of YOLOv3 by starting with the pretrained weights of "darknet53.conv.74".

Could you please provide the default argument settings to reproduce the mAPs?

issue.title: Implement Yolo-LSTM (~+4-9 AP) for detection on Video with high mAP and without blinking issues

milestone.title: Yolo works with crowds and occlusions
milestone.description: Yolo works with crowds and occlusions without re-identification errors: 1. Yolo-LSTM for Video, 2. Yolo without NMS or with high nms_threshold, 3. Hungarian_algorithm + Kalman Filter (SORT-tracker), 4. Think about getting a track_id inside the Yolo network....

repository.name: darknet
repository.description: YOLOv4 / Scaled-YOLOv4 / YOLO - Neural Networks for Object Detection (Windows and Linux version of Darknet )

issue.body:
Implement Yolo-LSTM detection network that will be trained on Video-frames for mAP increasing and solve blinking issues.

* https://arxiv.org/abs/1705.06368v3
* https://arxiv.org/abs/1506.04214v2
* Multi-object Tracking with Neural Gating Using Bilinear LSTM: https://web.engr.oregonstate.edu/~lif/1925.pdf


----

Think about - can we use Transformer (Vaswani et al., 2017) / GPT2 / BERT for frame-sequences instead of word-sequences https://d4mucfpksywv.cloudfront.net/better-language-models/language_models_are_unsupervised_multitask_learners.pdf and https://vk.com/away.php?to=https%3A%2F%2Farxiv.org%2Fpdf%2F1706.03762.pdf&cc_key=

Or can we use Transformer-XL https://arxiv.org/abs/1901.02860v2 or UNIVERSAL TRANSFORMERS https://arxiv.org/abs/1807.03819v3 for Long-time sequences?
